snippet: In different ways, with a touch of humor, advertising for Las Vegas, McDonald’s, Gold Peak Tea and Huffy bicycles addresses the frustrations of hard-pressed workers.
abstract: Many big advertisers, including the city of Las Vegas, McDonald's and Coca-Cola, are mounting campaigns that tap into a sense of frustration among workers in order to sell products portrayed as minor luxuries; marketers, responding to low employment numbers, are adopting the theme of workers’ rights at a time when unions themselves are confronting declines in membership and influence.
lead_paragraph: In different ways, with a touch of humor, advertising for Las Vegas, McDonald’s, Gold Peak Tea and Huffy bicycles addresses the frustrations of hard-pressed workers.

headline.seo: Ads for McDonald’s and Las Vegas Aimed at Harried Workers
headline.main: In Ads, the Workers Rise Up ... and Go to Lunch
